links.note: Visual Studio Code

links.title: MariaDB
links.note: GPL fork of MySQL

links.title: MySQL
links.note: Dual commercial and GPL licenses from Oracle

links.title: MySQL 8.0 Reference Manual  /  SQL Statement Syntax
Express edition
links.note: dubbed free Oracle database for everyone

links.title: Amazon Aurora (MySQL/PostgreSQL)
links.note: MySQL and PostgreSQL-compatible relational database built for the cloud

links.title: Google Cloud SQL (MySQL/PostgreSQL/MS SQL)
links.note: Cloud SQL is a fully managed MySQL, PostgreSQL, and SQL Server database service

links.title: Azure SQL Database (MSSQL)
links.note: Managed, intelligent SQL in the cloud

links.title: Azure Database for MySQL
links.note: Enterprise-ready, fully managed community MySQL

links.title: Azure Database for PostgreSQL
links.note: Enterprise-ready, fully managed community PostgreSQL

links.title: Azure Database for MariaDB
links.note: Enterprise-ready, fully managed community MariaDB

links.title: MongoDB
links.note: MongoDB is a general purpose, document-based, distributed database

links.title: Apache CouchDB
links.note: Seamless multi-master sync, that scales from Big Data to Mobile, with an Intuitive HTTP/JSON API and designed for Reliability

links.title: Amazon DocumentDB
links.note: Fast, scalable, highly available MongoDB-compatible database service

links.title: Google Cloud Firestore (NoSQL)
links.note: Cloud Firestore is a fast, fully managed, serverless, cloud-native NoSQL document database

links.title: Google Firebase (Realtime Database)
links.note: cloud-hosted NoSQL database that lets you store and sync data between your users in realtime

links.title: Google Cloud Memory Store (Redis)
links.note: Fully-managed in-memory data store service for Redis

links.title: Amazon Dynamo DB
links.note: key-value and document database

links.title: Amazon ElastiCache for Redis
links.note: Built on open-source Redis and compatible with the Redis APIs

links.title: Azure Cache for Redis
links.note: fully managed version of the popular open-source Redis server with a turnkey caching solution

links.title: Table Storage (Azure)
links.note: NoSQL key-value store

links.title: Redis
links.note: open source (BSD licensed), in-memory data structure store, used as a database, cache and message broker

links.title: Data Warehouse
links.note: A data warehouse is a system that pulls together data from many different sources within an organization for reporting and analysis. The reports created from complex queries within a data warehouse are used to make business decisions.

links.title: SQL Data Warehouse (Azure)
links.note: cloud data warehouse for enterprises

links.title: Amazon Quantum Ledger Database (QLDB)
links.note: Fully managed ledger database that provides a transparent, immutable, and cryptographically verifiable transaction log. Owned by a central trusted authority

links.title: Time Series
links.note: Time-series data has specific characteristics such as typically arriving in time order form, data is append-only, and queries are always over a time interval. While relational databases can store this data, they are inefficient at processing this data as they lack optimizations such as storing and retrieving data by time intervals.

links.title: Amazon Timestream
links.note: managed time series database

links.title: In-memory
links.note: a type of nonrelational database that relies primarily on memory for data storage; designed to attain minimal response time by eliminating the need to access disks

links.title: Amazon ElastiCache for Redis
links.note: Built on open-source Redis and compatible with the Redis APIs

links.title: Amazon ElastiCache for Memcached
links.note: Managed, Memcached-compatible, in-memory store. Sub-millisecond latency to power real-time applications.

links.title: Azure Cache for Redis
links.note: fully managed version of the popular open-source Redis server with a turnkey caching solution

links.title: Graph
links.note: database that uses graph structures for semantic queries with nodes, edges, and properties to represent and store data

links.title: Amazon Neptune
links.note: purpose-built, high-performance graph database engine optimized for storing billions of relationships and querying the graph with milliseconds latency

links.title: Apache TinkerPop Gremlin
links.note: Gremlin is the graph traversal language of Apache TinkerPop. Gremlin is a functional, data-flow language that enables users to succinctly express complex traversals on (or queries of) their application"s property graph.

links.title: SPARQL
links.note: Query language

links.title: Object Relational Mapping
links.note: technique that lets you query and manipulate data from a database using an object-oriented paradigm

links.title: Bookshelf.js
links.note: a JavaScript ORM for Node.js, built on the Knex SQL query builder. It features both Promise-based and traditional callback interfaces, transaction support, eager/nested-eager relation loading, polymorphic associations, and support for one-to-one, one-to-many, and many-to-many relations

links.title: Knex.js
links.note: "batteries included" SQL query builder for Postgres, MSSQL, MySQL, MariaDB, SQLite3, Oracle, and Amazon Redshift

links.title: Sequelize
links.note: promise-based Node.js ORM for Postgres, MySQL, MariaDB, SQLite and Microsoft SQL Server

links.title: TypeORM
links.note: ORM that can run in NodeJS, Browser, Cordova, PhoneGap, Ionic, React Native, NativeScript, Expo, and Electron platforms and can be used with TypeScript and JavaScript (ES5, ES6, ES7, ES8)

links.title: Massive
links.note: data mapper for Node.js and PostgreSQL

links.title: Loopback
links.note: open source Node.js framework based on Express that enables you to quickly create dynamic end-to-end REST APIs and connect to backend systems such as databases and SOAP or REST services

links.title: Waterline
links.note: provides a uniform API for accessing stuff from different kinds of databases and protocols. That means you write the same code to get and store things like users, whether they live in MySQL, MongoDB, neDB, or Postgres.

links.title: Strapi
links.note: open source Headless CMS Front-End

links.title: AngularJS
links.note: version 1.x

links.title: Ember
links.note: A framework for ambitious web developers.

links.title: Preact
links.note: Fast 3kB alternative to React with the same modern API.

links.title: Svelte
links.note: Cybernetically enhanced web apps

links.title: Vulcan
links.note: full-stack React+GraphQL framework
